structured_sections.heading: Initiate a New Proposal - Proposal Development Routing Form (PDRF)
structured_sections.content: To begin, log into the Stanford Electronic Research Administration (SeRA) system using your SUNet ID and passphrase[cite: 44]. Depending on your access level, you will see one of two options on the right-hand side of the homepage[cite: 45]. Research Administrators will see a 'Start Proposal' button; click this and select 'PDRF' from the dropdown menu[cite: 46, 78]. Investigators will see a 'Start PDRF' button to click directly[cite: 88, 103]. In the 'Start Transaction' window that appears, you must select an 'Agreement Type' and 'Agreement Subtype'[cite: 104]. You will then be asked if a Cayuse application has already been started for the proposal[cite: 126]. If not, select 'No' and click 'Start'[cite: 107, 108]. If a Cayuse application does exist, select 'Yes' and enter the Cayuse Proposal ID before clicking 'Start'[cite: 132, 133].

structured_sections.heading: PDRF Screen Navigation
structured_sections.content: At the top left and top right of the screen, there are navigation menus that can be expanded or compressed[cite: 163]. The left-hand menu contains links for navigating within the PDRF and SeRA, while the right-hand menu contains action buttons and quick links.

structured_sections.heading: Left-hand Navigation Menu (LHN)
structured_sections.content: The Left Hand Navigation (LHN) menu allows you to move between different pages of the PDRF[cite: 185, 190]. The links include: 'Home' [cite: 169], 'SPO-######' to go to the project summary page [cite: 170, 172], 'Proposal (P#)' for the proposal summary page [cite: 173, 187], 'PR######' or 'Transaction Home' for the PDRF's main screen [cite: 174, 175, 188, 189], links for each section of the form like 'PI & Project Location' [cite: 176], and 'Emails'[cite: 184]. You can also navigate using the 'Previous' and 'Next' buttons at the bottom right of each page[cite: 190, 191, 192].

structured_sections.heading: Right-hand Navigation Menus (RHM)
structured_sections.content: The Right Hand Menu (RHM) is divided into 'Actions' and 'Quick Links'[cite: 195, 211, 234]. The 'Actions' menu, which also appears at the bottom of each page, includes options to 'Save' [cite: 205], 'Reassign' the PDRF [cite: 206], 'Review for Completeness' [cite: 207], 'Submit for Approval' [cite: 208], and 'Terminate' the transaction[cite: 210, 218]. The 'Quick Links' menu includes 'View PDRF' for a PDF summary [cite: 228, 235], 'Add Project Comments' [cite: 229, 236], 'Add Attachments' [cite: 231, 239], and other view options[cite: 227].

structured_sections.heading: PI & Project Location
structured_sections.content: This section captures details about the Principal Investigator and where the project work will be conducted[cite: 242].

structured_sections.heading: Principal Investigator
structured_sections.content: In the 'Principal Investigator' field, enter the first three letters of the PI's SUNet ID or name to select them from a list[cite: 244]. Once selected, the PI's contact information and any outside affiliations will be displayed[cite: 257, 258]. You must select the PI's 'Appointment Type' (e.g., Academic/Summer or Calendar) and enter their percentage of effort for the project[cite: 261, 266, 267]. Then, indicate if all of the PI's effort will be directly charged to the project[cite: 277]. If not, you must specify how the effort is accounted for, such as 'Cost Sharing' or 'Student Augmentation' from a dropdown list[cite: 279, 286, 293].

structured_sections.heading: Project Location
structured_sections.content: Click the 'Add Location' button to specify where the project work will occur[cite: 317]. For each location, you must indicate if it is the 'Primary' location [cite: 335], the 'Location Type' (e.g., Stanford Office/Lab, Non-Stanford Location) [cite: 342], and provide details like Building and Room number[cite: 343]. You also need to answer questions about whether the space is assigned to the PI and if any construction or rent is required[cite: 326, 329]. If a location is not approved for use, department chair approval must be attached[cite: 363, 392].

structured_sections.heading: Major Goals
structured_sections.content: Click the '+Add/Edit Major Goal' button to provide a brief statement of the project's overall objectives[cite: 396, 400]. This information will automatically be shared across all participating investigators' records in SeRA[cite: 398]. Major Goal information can be edited by anyone with an active SU Net ID directly within the SeRA Disclosures / Current & Pending Support Report[cite: 408, 409].

structured_sections.heading: Admin & Sponsor Details
structured_sections.content: This section covers administrative details, project contacts, and sponsor information[cite: 410]. All fields marked with an asterisk are required[cite: 412, 414]. You must define the 'Project Activities' (e.g., Research, Training/Instruction) and specify if the work is On or Off Campus[cite: 417, 418, 419].

structured_sections.heading: Project Contacts
structured_sections.content: You must designate a 'Department Contact' and a 'Department PTA Setup Contact' by searching for them by their SUNet ID[cite: 434, 437, 440, 444]. Using SUNet IDs is recommended as they are unique to each person[cite: 448].

structured_sections.heading: Sponsor Details
structured_sections.content: Search for and select the project's sponsor[cite: 451]. If the sponsor is not found, you can submit a Help Ticket to have them added[cite: 452, 455]. You must indicate if the proposal is a 'Limited Submission' and if there is a 'Sponsor Deadline'[cite: 460, 467]. You also need to select the 'Submission Method' from a dropdown list that includes options like 'Cayuse', 'Email', 'FedConnect', and others[cite: 472]. The form also asks about restrictions on non-U.S. citizen participation and on the publication of research results[cite: 528, 532].

structured_sections.heading: Project Personnel
structured_sections.content: This section is for listing all Stanford investigators and other personnel involved in the project[cite: 543].

structured_sections.heading: Stanford Investigators
structured_sections.content: Click 'Add Investigator' to add all participating Stanford investigators, including research staff, postdocs, and students who are key personnel[cite: 545, 547, 563]. All individuals listed must approve their participation[cite: 558]. In the 'Investigator Details' tab, you will specify their role, effort, and which department will approve their research[cite: 569, 570, 587]. In the 'Approvers & FYIs' tab, you can manage the routing order for approvals and add individuals to receive FYI notifications[cite: 594, 600, 603, 623]. Once ready, click the 'ROUTE' button to begin the approval process for that investigator[cite: 625, 638].

structured_sections.heading: Additional Personnel
structured_sections.content: Use the 'Add Personnel' button to include non-key Stanford personnel, SLAC personnel, or subrecipient personnel budgeted on the project[cite: 674, 687]. For these individuals, you will indicate if they are from Stanford or another institution and select their project role[cite: 688, 689].

structured_sections.heading: Budget Questions
structured_sections.content: This section gathers high-level budget information, including details on indirect costs (IDC), cost sharing, and subawards[cite: 759].

structured_sections.heading: Budget Information
structured_sections.content: Enter the total 'Amount Requested' for the proposal[cite: 761]. You must also indicate whether the sponsor has a salary cap[cite: 762]. If the sponsor is the NIH, additional questions will appear regarding the use of a modular budget and the inclusion of administrative salaries[cite: 772, 773, 774, 788].

structured_sections.heading: Indirect Costs (IDC)
structured_sections.content: Indicate if the proposal uses an F&A (indirect cost) rate that is less than Stanford's negotiated rates[cite: 790]. If it is a reduced rate, you must specify if it's a pre-approved exception or a project-specific waiver and enter the requested rate percentage[cite: 799, 818, 821].

structured_sections.heading: Cost Share
structured_sections.content: Indicate if the proposal includes cost sharing[cite: 836]. If yes, click 'Add Row' and provide details for each source, including whether it's internal or external, mandatory or voluntary, and cash or in-kind[cite: 837, 839, 845, 848]. For internal cash cost sharing, you must provide a guarantee PTA[cite: 865].

structured_sections.heading: Subawards
structured_sections.content: Indicate if the proposal includes any subawards[cite: 892]. If yes, click 'Add Subrecipient' and enter the institution's name and the Subrecipient PI's name[cite: 894, 895, 897, 902].

structured_sections.heading: Budget Details
structured_sections.content: This section requires a detailed project budget[cite: 915]. You will create rate schedules for different indirect cost rates and activities[cite: 941, 948]. The page includes fields for budget periods, investigator effort, and direct costs broken down by category[cite: 966, 1021, 1041]. The F&A calculations are performed automatically based on the selected rate agreement and IDC basis (TDC, MTDC, or Other Modified Basis)[cite: 1051, 1107].

structured_sections.heading: Project Questions
structured_sections.content: This section covers compliance topics, data and materials, export control, and other research-related issues[cite: 1153].

structured_sections.heading: Compliance Information
structured_sections.content: You must answer 'Yes' or 'No' to whether the project involves animal subjects (APLAC), human subjects (IRB), human stem cells (SCRO), or biosafety concerns (APB)[cite: 1155, 1156, 1178, 1210, 1212]. If the answer is 'Yes' to any of these, you will be prompted to add the relevant protocol information[cite: 1157, 1179, 1211, 1220].

structured_sections.heading: Data/Materials & Export Control
structured_sections.content: You must answer questions related to GDPR to indicate if personal data from the EEA will be processed or transferred[cite: 1237]. You must also answer questions to determine if an Export Control review is needed, for example, if the project involves access to disclosure-restricted information or items on the US Munitions List (ITAR)[cite: 1253, 1264, 1265, 1266].

structured_sections.heading: Attachments
structured_sections.content: You must attach required documents to the PDRF, including program guidelines, the full proposal (unless submitted via an external system like Cayuse), an internal detailed budget, and a budget justification[cite: 1441, 1442, 1443, 1447, 1448, 1449]. Use the blue paperclip links to upload documents[cite: 1451]. It is a best practice to use the notes field to identify attachments and to use the edit/update feature for new versions of a document rather than adding a new file[cite: 1471, 1472, 1492].

structured_sections.heading: Approvers & Comments
structured_sections.content: In this final section, you can add remarks for approvers and your institutional official[cite: 1501]. You must review the default list of approvers, add or delete individuals as needed, and set the routing order[cite: 1502, 1503, 1504, 1506]. You can also add individuals to an FYI list[cite: 1519]. Finally, you must select the appropriate Institutional Organization (Office of Sponsored Research or School of Medicine’s Research Management Group)[cite: 1520].

structured_sections.heading: Review for Completeness and Routing
structured_sections.content: Before submitting, use the 'Review for Completeness' action to check for any missing required fields[cite: 1536, 1540]. The system will provide links to the sections that need correction[cite: 1543, 1545]. Once all fields are complete, click 'Submit for Approval'[cite: 1544, 1568]. After routing, the PDRF will move from your 'Action Items' to your 'My Pipeline', where you can monitor its status[cite: 1585, 1586].
